medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started 10 days ago with fever and stomachache in the epigastrium that worsened with food. Over the last 10 days, nausea has worsened significantly, with the patient only able to tolerate crackers, which provoked vomiting with yellow acid material. She has not been able to keep food or most medications down for the past 10 days. Since the onset, she has not had any bowel movements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Sarcoidosis, myasthenia gravis, hypothyroidism, osteoporosis, gastritis, esophagitis, duodenitis, history of upper gastrointestinal bleeding from NSAID use, cataracts, chronic pain, depression, hematuria (negative CT), thyroid cancer secondary to radiation exposure (status post thyroidectomy).
